main event: A bright round fireball or 'nickle' was sighted by two pilots in an aircraft 10 miles northwest of Langley Air Force Base, Virginia.
interesting points: The object appeared at one o'clock high and descended straight down, disappearing into a solid cloud deck at around 23,000 feet.
The object left a thin black smoke trail that remained visible for about 2 minutes.
The object was described as resembling a small meteorite or rocket.
No other reports of the sighting were received, and the intelligence officer suggested it could have been a meteorite.
The pilots reported the sighting to the Washington Center at 2115Z local time.
location: 10 miles northwest of Langley AFB, Virginia
witnesses: Capt. Harry W. Delancey and Maj. Alfred C. Seers of HQ TAC
